title: CES 2026: UAIS √ó MICROIP Partnership Announcement
description: Today, we're preparing to unveil a new partnership with MICROIP at CES and share the first signal of what's next for UAIS. This is part of a broader effort we've been building toward for some time.
longDescription:
Today, we're preparing to unveil a new partnership with MICROIP at CES and share the first signal of what's next for UAIS.

This is part of a broader effort we've been building toward for some time. At the beginning of 2026, we'll reveal something significant that reflects where we're headed and the scale of what we're building.

More partnerships, more announcements, and more to share in the months ahead.

CES¬Æ unites the brightest tech luminaries to pioneer the future and solve the world's biggest problems. This is where brands get business done, meet new partners and where the industry's sharpest minds take the stage to unveil their latest releases and boldest breakthroughs.

The world's most powerful tech event is your place to experience the innovations transforming how we live. This is where global brands get business done, meet new partners and where the industry's sharpest minds take the stage to unveil their latest releases and boldest breakthroughs.
highlights: Partnership announcement with MICROIP
First signal of what's next for UAIS
Major reveal at the beginning of 2026
Part of CES 2026 - the world's most powerful tech event
Where global brands get business done and partnerships spark real growth

title: AI x Healthcare - Silicon Valley Investing Summit
description: Held during JP Morgan Healthcare Week, the Silicon Valley Investing Summit brings together select startups and accredited investors for curated dealflow and high-level networking.
longDescription:

title: AI x Robotics
description: Join us at the heart of innovation for a night where founders, leaders, and investors connect to shape what is next in AI and Robotics.
longDescription:
Join us in the heart of San Francisco, where the global hub of innovation thrives, for an evening at the forefront of Artificial Intelligence and Robotics. Hosted by Universal AI Services, this event brings together industry leaders, fast-scaling startups, and top venture capital firms who are shaping the future of intelligent systems.

Expect keynote talks from recognized experts, startup pitches reviewed by leading investors, and a networking dinner designed to connect you with the people driving real-world impact.

The community is intentionally designed to spark opportunities:

‚Ä¢ AI & Robotics leaders executives driving adoption in leading organizations
‚Ä¢ AI & Robotics founders fast-growing startups with real traction and bold ambitions
‚Ä¢ Investors and researchers venture capital firms and labs advancing the frontier

This is the room where ideas meet capital, where talent meets opportunity, and where the future of AI and Robotics comes into focus.

agenda.title: Program (keynote speakers + lightning round pitches from VC panels)

highlights: Keynote talks from recognized experts
Startup pitches reviewed by leading investors
Networking dinner with industry leaders
Connecting founders, leaders, and investors

title: Pitch Playoffs: Physical AI
description: We're bringing together 10 early-stage startups across physical AI. Every attendee gets 3 voting tokens at check-in to "invest" in their favorite products during the booth showcase.
longDescription:
We're bringing together 10 early-stage startups across physical AI. Every attendee gets 3 voting tokens at check-in to "invest" in their favorite products during the booth showcase. Walk the room, meet founders, try products, and drop your tokens where you see the most potential.

At the end of the showcase, we'll tally the votes.

The top 3 startups earn a spot on stage for a Shark Tank‚Äìstyle pitch in front of a investor panel, with live feedback and a room full of builders watching.

Who this is for:
‚Ä¢ Founders & startups looking for users, signal, and investor attention
‚Ä¢ Investors & angels looking for curated, pre-filtered dealflow
‚Ä¢ Operators, engineers, and tech folks who want to see what's being built next in SF

agenda.title: Startup booths, voting, networking, & get refreshments (3 tokens per attendee)
$5,000 analytics platform presentation mapping trends across 100k+ research papers
Live pitches: 3 finalists √ó investor panel Q&A

highlights: 10 early-stage startups showcasing physical AI products

title: AI in the Physical World: An MIT √ó Harvard Three-Part Series
description: Universal AI Services convenes a three-month evening series in collaboration with the Harvard Club of San Francisco and the MIT Club of Northern California examining how artificial intelligence is increasingly embedded in the physical world and the industries that operate within it.
longDescription:
Universal AI Services convenes a three-month evening series in collaboration with the Harvard Club of San Francisco and the MIT Club of Northern California examining how artificial intelligence is increasingly embedded in the physical world and the industries that operate within it. The series takes place in San Francisco from 6:00 to 9:00 PM, with doors opening at 5:30 PM. Each program brings together researchers, technologists, practitioners, and industry leaders to explore the evolving relationship between AI systems, physical environments, and real-world deployment.

**February 17 - Entertainment, Music, and Media**

The opening event examines how AI is reshaping entertainment, music, and film across both digital and physical contexts. As AI tools influence creative production, performance, and distribution, and as embodied systems enter studios, stages, and public spaces, this program considers the implications of intelligent technologies for cultural expression and audience experience. Topics include AI-assisted music and film production, immersive and interactive media, humanoid performers, and robotics in live and experiential settings.

**March 11 - Physical AI**

The second event focuses on the technical foundations of AI systems that perceive, move, and act in the physical world. Discussions address advances in robotics, sensing, foundation models, autonomy, and edge intelligence, with particular attention to real-world perception, safety, and deployment beyond simulation. The program emphasizes both the opportunities and the limitations of current approaches to embodied intelligence.

**April 16 - Construction and Real Estate**

The final event turns to the built environment, examining how AI is influencing construction and real estate through a combination of robotics and software. Topics include robotic labor, autonomous site inspection, AI-supported planning and simulation, development intelligence, and property analytics. The discussion considers how these technologies are reshaping design, construction workflows, and long-term management of buildings and urban systems.

Through this series, Universal AI Services facilitates dialogue across academic, technical, and industry communities, creating a shared space for careful examination of how AI is moving from research settings into everyday environments.
highlights: Three-part series in collaboration with Harvard Club of San Francisco and MIT Club of Northern California
February 17: Entertainment, Music, and Media
March 11: Physical AI
April 16: Construction and Real Estate
Each session 6:00 PM - 9:00 PM (doors at 5:30 PM)
Brings together researchers, technologists, practitioners, and industry leaders
